contents: Jobs, collaborations, and women leaders of the global chemistry enterprise: an overview -- Jobs, careers, and global mobility. Supply and demand of chemists in the United States -- Mothers who are chemists in American academe: resources to support academic parents in chemistry -- How does ACS promote international experience and global mobility? -- Innovations from international collaborations. ACS international activities: mechanisms to advance member-serving global engagement -- International year of chemistry: our celebration -- International collaborations -- Pittcon/ACS international visiting scientists program -- The Malta conferences: fostering international scientific collaborations toward peace in the Middle East -- Pacific polymer federation: a model for international cooperation -- Perspectives from the Brazilian chemical society (SBQ) -- Towards a sustainable partnership between ACS & FACS: what's next? -- International research funding in the chemical sciences: latest developments -- International collaborations in R & D: an Indian perspective -- Building global capabilities and delivering continual innovation at 3M -- Ingenuity in the global market: how to leverage open innovation to achieve results for your organization -- Seed, foster, believe, dream and act: capacity building in Kenya by Novartis Global Discovery Chemistry, Seeding Labs, the International Activities Committee, and the Computers in Chemistry Division of the ACS between 2010-2014 -- Science for Haiti: international collaborations to advance Haitian science and science education capacity and innovation -- Women leaders of the global chemistry enterprise. A retrospective view of my 70 years in chemistry -- Ten lessons from a lifetime of science -- From building roads to building peace: a woman chemist's odyssey -- The magnificent journey -- Partners for progress and prosperity: a personal and professional journey -- Two decades of research on natural products chemistry from Brazilian biodiversity: inspirations and motivations -- Portrait of a professional life: work, challenges, and satisfaction, all achieved in small steps -- Academic and personal evolution through thirty-eight years: two parallel tracks? -- Peace and satisfaction at the end of a lot of work, obstacles, efforts, and challenges -- Chance and destiny on the road to becoming the first woman professor of chemical engineering in Romania -- My experience being a woman and a professor of chemistry in Morocco -- Experiences of a female chemist in South Africa -- Glimpse of my scientific path: the quest continues -- Challenges and opportunities in Indian science: my experiences -- Participation of women scientists and engineers in Japan -- Achieving work-family harmony: my experiences as a chemist and a housewife.
